intro: Benoicanthus gruicollis var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed benoicanthus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically herbaceous growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow to orange. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
